definition: to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: After speaking, the official turned and left.
sentences.chinese: 说完，这位官员立刻掉头就走了。

sentences.english: As soon as the employer ask for money, you can go without hovering.
sentences.chinese: 只要用人单位一说要你交钱，你掉头就走便是了。

sentences.english: When he saw me coming he sheered off in the opposite direction.
sentences.chinese: 他一看到我过来，掉头就走了。

sentences.english: If you walk away now, I'll die with a broken heart.
sentences.chinese: 如果你掉头就走，我会心碎而死的。

definition: to storm off in a huff (idiom)
to leave
to rush out through a door (idiom)
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
furious/enraged
to break into a run
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
to swagger off/to walk off (or drive off etc) without a second thought for those left behind
to get really angry
to keep totally silent/noiselessly
to not say a word
(coll.) to beat it/to take French leave
to throw down/to drop (bomb)
to abandon
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
